1.content:
The Buchanans were getting ready to set out for the day. The weather outside was absolutely beautiful and the rain had finally stopped falling from the sky. "So does anyone have any suggestions on where we should go today?" Richard asked as he started to gather the needed items for them to leave the house for the day. His keys and wallet were the main things that he needed, but also grabbed his cell phone just in case somebody from the office needed something.

His son, Jason, was finishing up his breakfast of pancakes and juice. After stuffing the final remnants of the breakfast in his mouth he turned to his father and with a mouth full of food he said. "You know what, we could always go hiking today." He continued to chew his food as he looked around the table to his siblings.

"Or you can finish up your chewing before you answer." Sarah answered back as she continued to text her friends about her busy social scene. Being a sophomore in college, she was always trying to do her best to balance a decent social life with her academic studies. Majoring in education, Sarah was hoping to, at least one day, teaching history and social studies to middle-schoolers.

"Yeah Jason." Julia agreed as she tried to shield her own plate from any flying projectiles coming from Jason's mouth. "I'm trying to eat too."

Jason swallowed the contents of his mouth and looked at his sisters. "Sorry, I was just trying to give a suggestion on where we can go."

Sarah sighed as she locked her phone and replied to her father's earlier question. "Well Dad, we could go to that shopping center on highway 64. Richard tried to remember what she was talking about. A couple weeks earlier when they were going to one of Julia's basketball games, the family saw a shopping center that seemed to be really busy.

"Yeah, honey." Emily agreed as she put her arm around her husband and embracing him. "It's only a half an hour away and it will be a great drive." She motioned to the cloudless sky.

"I think you're right." Richard agreed as he looked around the table to his family. "Well what do you guys think?" Jason really had his mind set on hiking and really didn't want to do any shopping, but Julia seemed interested. "Well, finish up, go change, and we can go." The girls talked excitedly as they brought their plates to the sink and made their way to the door. Richard put his hand on his son's shoulder. "We can go hiking next weekend. I mean, it's supposed to be nice next weekend too. Hmm?"

"I guess..." Jason replied back to him as he got up to clear his plate from the table too. "But can stop somewhere for lunch today?"

"When are you not thinking about food?" He answered back as he tussled his son's hair. Jason, groaning is displeasure, haphazardly fixed his hair.

Half an hour later, everybody was ready to go and they started to pile into the SUV. Richard wore his usual khaki pants, a light blue polo, and on his feet he wore his usual grey trainers. Emily was next in the SUV with her light yellow sundress with black flats. Sarah decided to take it easy and wore her purple university tank top, pink short shorts, with pink flip flops on her feet. Jason sat in the back seat with his favorite black Call of Duty T-shirt, blue jeans, and black trainers. Julia climbed in last, but decided to follow Sarah's example and wore a simple white blouse, jean shorts, with light brown converse sneakers. Richard turned on the vehicle and turned to look at everyone in the back. "Did everyone grab their allowances so that you all won't bother us for any money?" Richard asked as he looked in the rear view mirror to see everyone nodding their heads. He then turned his attention over to his, who was busy looking at something on her phone. "Do you know what time they open?"

His wife turned her hazel eyes to her husband and replied back to him. "I was just checking that." She chuckled as she looked back over at her phone. "Hmm... That's odd. I can't find anything on the internet about it."

"That certainly is odd." He agreed. "I hope they didn't close down. So let's go by and check it out." Everyone let him know of their agreence. "Well there we go." He chuckled as he put the SUV into reverse and backed out of the driveway. Richard turned the radio station to the 'oldies' station to help relive his childhood in Cincinnati.

"Dad, can you change it into something more upbeat?" Sarah wondered as she started to look for her earbuds.

"Sweety, why don't you just put in your ear buds and listen to the music you want to." Emily asked as she giggled at the way her husband acted when he heard his favorite songs.

"This is going to be the longest 20 minutes of my life." Sarah complained as she finally found her earbuds and put them into her ears to listen to some 'good' music.

The trip was over in a matter of no time and the kids were eager to get out of the SUV. Emily got out too and stretched to her full extent. "That wasn't too bad was it?" She asked her kids who were getting out of the car.

Jason got out and looked around. "It looks like it closed down." He stated as he noticed the lack of cars in the parking lot. "Are you sure they're still open?"

Richard walked up to the main store and cups his hands over his eyes to peer inside the window. "It looks closed, but..." He walked closer to the door and gave it a yank and found it quite easy to open. "But the door is open." As he opened the door wider a distinct chime rang out to announce the presence of visitors entering the dusty shelves of merchandise.

"Welcome!" A gravely voice called out to them as they filed in one by one through the door.

The family looked in the direction of the gravely voice and waved their hands at the old man who seemed to be having an intensive conversation with a mouse sitting on the desk. "Err... Hello." Emily replied as she tried not to pay too much attention to the conversation the two of them were having.

The old man looked up from his conversation and pointed around the store. "You're free to roam the store, just don't read anything out loud or it could be life changing." The old man cackled and the mouse that was sitting on the counter seemed to be letting out rhythmic squeaks to.

'If I didn't know better, I would say that mouse is laughing too.' Emily thought to herself, thinking it odd with such behavior. "Now kids." She said out loud as she looked over to see all three of them going off in different directions. "Don't go too far and if you make a mess, I will make you clean it up."

"Ok." All three answered back to her, since they knew that she indeed meant it.

Who should we follow?
1.title: Let us begin...

11.content:
Richard and Emily watched as their children scattered throughout the store like a bunch of kindergartners released onto a playground. "Did they even listen to us?" Emily asked as she rubber her temples to help alleviate a growing pressure. "Well, at least we have some time to ourselves." She turned to her husband and sighed. "Really, you can't leave work alone? You're on vacation!"

Richard groaned as he locked his phone and put it back into his pocket. "I was just checking a message." He replied back to her.

"I just want one week where you're not having to check your phone." She said as she turned to her husband with her eyes starting to tear up slightly.

"Sorry, Em." Richard replied as he embraced his wife but was soon interrupted by a voice from behind them.

“What greater thing is there for two human souls, than to feel that they are joined for life–to strength each other in all labor, to rest on each other in all sorrow, to minister to each other in silent unspeakable memories at the moment of the last parting?” A woman's voice replied to them. Both Emily and Ricard turned their heads to see a young woman around the age of 25 and looked a lot like Richard's young intern.

"You nearly gave us a fright." Emily replied. "Do you work here?"

"Jennifer?" Richard asked. "Aren't you supposed to be at work working on the Taylor account?"

The dark eyes of the young woman seemed to entrance the both of them. "Oh is that who you see me as and yes, you can say that." She replied dreamily. "I see that you're having a little trouble with your marriage. The love is still there, but the trust is waning away."

"How dare you." Ricard declared as he started to put his wife behind him, as if to protect her from an unknown force.

"You're right." Emily answered back to her. "I don't know how you know, but do you know of a way to help us fix it? We're doing therapy, but I really don't think that's working."

"I'm glad you asked!" The young woman announced with great pleasure. "If you follow me over to the counter, I think I have a couple of things that might help your marriage." She happily skipped to the end of the aisle and waited for the two of them to meet her at the glass counter. Emily eagerly followed the young woman and dragged Richard behind her who was still trying to figure out why the young woman looked like his office intern.

"So you have something that can help us?" Emily asked as she eagerly hoped for a cheaper and more efficient fix.

"That I do." The young woman replied with a grin on her face. "First I give you the fabled Medallion of Zulo." She put a coppery medallion on the counter, but for safe keeping, she had it in a plastic bag. "With this, you will be able to literally walk in another person's shoes."

"How does it work?" Richard asked as he carefully prodded the medallion with his finger as if it was an eerie biology experiment waiting to be dissected.

"I really can't tell you that until you purchase the item." The young woman answered. "We have to protect our ideas, after all." Her eyes sparkled slightly as she looked at the two of them. "Hmm... Let's see what else we have here." She pulled out a brown card board box with no letters or words written on it and like everything else around it, had dust all over it. "Inside this box you will always find new games that will certainly help put a spin on your marriage. Plus there will always be a family appropriate game too, you know, for the kids" She then pointed over to the left wall and they found a large, antique mirror. "That is the mirror of Guinevere. You see it's said that this mirror was made by Merlin himself and given to Guinevere on her wedding day."

"And let me guess, you won't tell us what it does until we buy it?" Richard asked.

"That would be correct." The young woman replied once more with a smile. "And the last thing I will have to show you is this pair of rings." She held up another bag with 2 rings, one silver and the other gold. "I will tell you about this one though." She said with a wink of her eye. "These are the rings of Ali Shar. You see Ali Shar was once a rich and powerful Caliph in olden Arabia. One ring will the Master and the other will be the Subordinate. The Master will be able to change the Subordinate, within reason of course."

"I hardly believe that." Richard scoffed as chuckled at the thought of it.

"So do you have an idea of what you would like to buy?" The young woman asked as she put the last bag down and waited patiently for an answer.
11.title: Richard and Emily

choices: One of the kids finds the medallion.
111.content:
"So do you have an idea of what you would like to buy?" The young woman asked as she put the last bag down and waited patiently for an answer. She smiled as she saw both Richard and Emily looking at the items. As they were looking over the items, the young woman heard a vibration and a muted ring tone.

Emily's face grew redder with frustration as she looked at her husband and sighed. "Go ahead and answer it."

"Are you sure?" He asked before he hurriedly ran outside to take the call to make sure that nobody lost any important accounts.

The young woman seeing the frustration on Emily's face, turned to look at her. "You know, while he's gone." She motioned down towards the counter. "You should go ahead and pick." Looking down, she picked up the bag containing the necklace. "May I suggest the Medallion of Zulo?"

Emily frustrated face soon calmed down by this suggestion. "Why would you suggest that?" She asked as she started to reach for it, but found that path blocked by the young woman, who had her hand on the bag and pulled it just out of reach.

"Well, the Medallion of Zulo will transform the person into the last person wearing a piece of clothing." She exclaimed as she looked over to Emily and noticed that she had a perplexed look on her face. "Silly me. I will explain it a little better. You see if you want to change into let's say your husband, all you will have to do it put on the medallion and touch it to a piece of his clothing. After touching, you will feel a small spark." She continued to explain the secrets of the medallion.

"So here's the real question." Emily asked as she feared the answer. "How much?" She brought her gaze over to the young girl's face and saw a slight twinkle coming from her eyes.

"Well, you're certainly in luck." She replied with a huge smile. "We're having a special today and that will only be $45.09."

"That's an odd amount." Emily replied as she began to dig through her purse and noticed that's the exact amount that she had in cash. She got it all out and handed it over to the young woman who gladly gave her the medallion and a quick guide how the medallion wored. As she put it into her purse, Emily had several ideas on how she was going to use it on both her husband and her kids.

As they left the mysterious shop, the Buchanans decided to continue a drive around and enjoy the cool and sunny weather. As Richard drove through the countryside, Emily thought about what she would be able to do with her newest purchase. Looking over at her husband, she couldn't forget how he stiffed her and left her alone in the store to answer the phone. 'All he wanted to do is talk to that bitch of an assistant that he has.' She fumed as she thought back to the store. She, however was brought out of her thoughts by her kids arguing behind her.

"Jason will you stop touching me?" Sarah complained as she glared at her brother how wasn't really doing anything, but playing on his PS Vita.

"I'm not touching you." Jason quickly responded as he glared back at her. Emily looked at her son and noticed that his head seemed to move rhythmically. Turning around and looking at his little sister, Jason also complained. "Julia stop kicking my seat."

Without skipping a beat, Julia glared back at him. "Well, stop humming while you play your game." Jason always had a habit of getting too engrossed into his game and had a tendency to hum the music as he played. While he had his own room, the family always had to tell him to stop humming.

"Sorry that I have something to do." He replied back to her. "You're just jealous that you didn't bring anything."

"Enough." Like a lion roaring, Richard yelled from the driver's seat. The 3 teenagers instantly calmed down and returned to what they were doing. He then turned to his wife. "You know I hate being the bad guy, why didn't you say anything to them?" Emily always had to watch the kids, play with them when they were younger, and cook for them every day. Richard always came home and started to watch sports after eating his supper. Just then, she had an idea on how to use the medallion and hopefully it will help put a new perspective on the family's life. She decided to use the medallion to ________.

One of the kids overhears and wants to try it out too.
11111.content:
As they drove home, the Buchanans were quiet in the back seat. All the kids had something to do, whether it was Jason playing his favorite video game or Sarah and Julia listening to their favorite music on their phones. So it was appropriate to say that it was quiet on the way back to their home. Richard looked over at his wife, who seemed to be entranced by an item in a plastic bag. Richard, while keeping an eye on the road, looked over at what his wife was seemingly entranced by and noticed that it was a metallic disc. "What's that?" Richard asked as he gestured toward the object in his wife's hands.

He chuckled when he saw his wife shake her head slightly to bring herself back to the real world. "Huh?" Emily asked seemingly bewildered by the question. Richard pointed back down to the medallion. "Oh, it's what I got at the shop back there. The lady that I bought it from said that it would change our lives."

This seemed to surprise Richard, not that the claim that it would change their lives, but the fact that somebody was there to help her. "Sorry that I had to take a call from the office. I'm fully on vacation now, the account is now done and closed." He couldn't help but smile as he watched his wife's eyes grow bigger with excitement. This would be the first time in several years that he was able to take a vacation. "So what does that thing do exactly?" He wondered as he came to a stop at a red light.

"From what she said, it can change a person based on the clothes they touch it to." She explained with great exhilaration and seemed to be ready to try it.

"So if you were to touch it to, let's say, your cheerleading uniform." He asked thinking about the cheerleader outfit that she wore when they were both in college together.

"Then I would look like I was in college again." She replied with a great smile on her face. "But I will have to stay that way for 12 hours at least, if I remember correctly."

11112.content:
The Buchanans enjoyed a somewhat relaxing drive through the countryside, but the occasional dispute coming from the back seat that seemed to disrupt the peace. "That's it." Emily cried out as she turned her body to face the back seat, where her children knew they had messed up and their faces certainly shown it. Julia instantly sat back in her seat, Jason turned his game system to sleep and looked out the window to make it seem that nothing was going on, and Sarah turned off her phone from texting with her boyfriend, Peter. She finally made up her decision on how to teach her entire family a lesson on how to respect each other. "When we get home we're going to have a family meeting."

Richard, not wanting to piss off his wife much more, didn't say a word and kept driving. As they grew nearer to their home, he heard his phone going off once more. Reaching down to pick it up and answer it, he soon realized that he was a little too slow and his wife had already reached down and grabbed it before he was able to. "What..." He asked as he looked over at his wife who turned his phone off and threw it into her purse.

"I already told you." Emily griped as her red, irritated face look back at him, almost as if to say, 'Go ahead and mess with me, I dare you.'

Richard sighed, as he knew when his wife was in one of her moods, not to add any more fuel to the fire. Plus he knew he could always call them back to see what the problem was. "Yes dear." He muttered as they pulled into the driveway.

The family filed into the living room and sat down on the furniture and waited for their Mom to come in. "What do you think we will have to do?" Julia wondered over to her brother as she remembered the last time, where they were grounded for a week and had to clean the house from the basement to the attic.

Sarah, pulling out her phone and started to text to her boyfriend, looked as if nothing was the matter replied. "I don't really care, I have to leave in a couple days anyhow."

"For what?" Jason asked as he thought it was unfair that she got to leave early even if they had to spend time at home.

"Oh, I promised Kim that I would go shopping for school with her." Sarah answered, not putting her phone down once. Even though school didn't really start back for another month, Sarah wanted to get a jump on the crowds and go shopping for the needed supplies. The three of them heard the front door close and turned to see their parent's walking in.

"And that will have to wait." Emily stated as she and Richard sat down on the love seat near the kitchen.

"What do you mean?" Sarah wondered as she put her phone down on the couch, trying to get a straight answer from her parents. "We've been planning this for the past month."

"I know, but I feel that we, as a family, have grown apart over the years and need a reminder of how to treat each other." Emily told the family as they were growing more annoyed with everything. "So, we will draw names from this bag and will use this medallion to take that person's place for the weekend." She held up the odd looking metal medallion, still sealed in its plastic bag and the bag that they used for designating their weekly chores.

Julia chuckled as she looked around at the perplexed family. "So if Jason draws my name, then he will have to wear my clothes and be me?" She nudged her brother to emphasize the fact.

"Well, yes and no. From what I read, you will have to use this medallion and touch it to the clothes." She instructed. "Then the magic from the medallion will do its work."

"Honey." Richard replied as he brought his hand over to cup hers. "Are you feeling okay?"

Emily looked over at her husband and smiled. "I've never felt better, honestly." She held out the bag to her husband. "Now I will give you the first chance to pick." Richard dug down deep to reach down into the bag to, at least humor his wife, and pick a name out of it. He felt a crumpled piece of paper and grabbed it to pull it out. Looking at it, he chuckled as he gave it to his wife to show her the name that he drew out. As she looked at the piece of paper, Emily couldn't help but chuckle. "Awe you get to be me." She replied as she showed the crumpled piece of paper to the others. "Now, since I already have the bag right here, I think I'll go ahead and draw too." She reached down into the bag and felt around the brim, where she stuck a piece earlier. "And, I got." She announced as she pulled out the name of her husband. "It looks like we'll get to know what it's like to be each other."

1112.content:
The rest of the day went pretty fast for the Buchanan's, after stopping to eat a Lou's Phat Wings, the family made their way back into their home to settle down for the day. Richard, not surprisingly, had to go back to the office to help Jennifer with the Taylor account. Emily and the kids decided to take it easy that night and not have to worry about going out anywhere or doing anything. "Mom have you seen my soccer uniform?" Julia asked as she stuck her head out her bedroom door. "I've looked everywhere and can't find it." Emily was walking down the hallway when she heard this and looked inside Julia's room and noticed that it looked much like a tornado passed through it.

"Jules." Emily replied with an exasperated look on her face. "I need you to pick this room up before you go to bed tonight or you will be grounded for a month." She turned to look at her daughter. "Do I make myself clear."

Julia looked at her Mom with look of defeat. "Yes, Ma'am. Have you seen it or do you know where it's at?"

Emily sighed. "Have you checked the car?" Julia shook her head. "Well then I suggest you get the keys out of my purse and check the trunk." Emily went back to work putting clothes away and not realizing that she forgot to take out the medallion from her purse.

Julia hummed a song that she was listening to earlier in her room and found her Mom's purse sitting on the kitchen counter, where she left it earlier. As she was looking for the car keys, Julia found an odd looking necklace in a plastic bag. "What's this?" She whispered to herself as picked up the bag to get a closer look at it.

"Hey squirt." Jason said as he ruffled his sister's hair, much to her chagrin. "Hope you have fun cleaning your room." He went over to the refrigerator to get a much deserved soda. "I just got mine done and now I'm going to go play Call of Duty." He chuckled at his sister's misfortune as he left the kitchen to go back up to his room to start his little video game beat-down on some unsuspecting noobs.

"I really hate it when he does that." Julia said as she tried to fix her hair. Even though she classified herself as a tomboy, she still liked to keep herself looking decent. She kept her hair longer so that her Mom wouldn't care too much on what she did, but still like to play in the sports that the school offered. She sighed as she looked closer at the medallion and noticed a note near the bag and opened it. Her eyes grew bigger as she read the note and what the necklace allegedly did.

She reread the note to make sure she knew what was going on, but soon had her attention interrupted by her Mom calling down to her. "Jules, were you able to find your uniform?" Julia quickly put the medallion under her shirt to hide it from view and grabbed the keys from her Mom's purse.

"Not yet, I'm about to go outside to check on it." She called back to her as she went out to the car to check the trunk of the car.

Back upstairs, Emily got a message from Sarah who was visiting a friend of hers and needed a ride back home. Even though she was old enough to drive, her parents didn't trust her with driving any of the cars. She picked up the phone to text her telling her that she was on her way when she heard the front door close. "Jules, I'm going to go get Sarah." She called down to her other daughter.

"Okay, can I stay here?" She asked as she walked up the stairs carrying her sport's bag.

"I don't really see the harm in it." Emily replied back to her as she walked by the messy room. "But I want this room at least half way picked up by the time I get back." She scolded as she waved good bye.

Julia chuckled slightly as she opened up her bag and pulled out the medallion.

11122.content:
After cleaning up her room, Julia quietly planned some fun for her older brother. She read one of her magazines until it was time for bed. Being the weekend, their parents really didn't mind them staying up until midnight and she had to wait awhile. She looked over at her phone and noticed that it was almost time. She smiled evilly and waited for her chance. With her door open, Julia watched with great anticipation for Jason to walk past her room to his room. "Night Jason." She called out to him, trying to act like nothing is out of the ordinary.

Jason leaned his head back into her room. "Night squirt." He replied as he chuckled to himself about his little joke and went to his room and closed the door. Julia, with her room right next to his, waited for the noise drowning fan to get turned on before she got everything ready. Almost as if on queue, she heard the faint drone of the box fan.

"Excellent." She whispered to herself as she reached for the medallion, which was still in the plastic bag, and a bundle of clothing. After waiting for another 10 minutes, Julia was ready to go. She cautiously snuck out of her room and next door to her brother's. Quietly opening the door. Julia heard the rhythmic breathing coming from her brother's bed and knew that he was asleep.

Making her way over to the bed, Julia certainly had to step over several things, a game remote and a couple books. "I thought he cleaned up." She whispered to herself, knowing that he wouldn't hear her over the constant drone of the box fan. With her plan in mind, Julia opened the bag and turned it inside out to keep herself from being transformed by the medallion. She then got the small bundle of clothing that she brought with her and made her way over to her brother. Laying the medallion on his shirtless body, Julia then touched the small bundle of clothing to it. As it lay on him, the small bundle of clothing, unbundled itself showing that it had her bra and panties. She watched in wonder as her brother's usually manly chest started to puff up slightly until it resembled her chest. Waiting for another 5 minutes, Julia took the clothing and the medallion off of her brother's body and made her way back to her room. She could only imagine her brother having lost his manhood, waking up the next morning in shock.

"It's going to be a great morning." She chuckled to herself as she hid the medallion and went back to bed.

1112221.content:
"Oh my gosh." Julia replied, feigning surprise, as she brought her hands up to her mouth. "You're right, they do look like a girl's chest." She drew closer to see to get a better look at it, even though she already knew what they looked and felt like. As she grew closer, Jason brought his only form of protection closer to his chest effectively covering it once more.

"Don't touch them, they feel weird." Jason complained.

'Well of course they feel weird.' Julia thought to herself as she noticed his shoulders weren't as broad as they were before.

She was brought out of her thoughts by Jason's own wonderings. "Maybe I should go tell Mom. She might know what to do."

Julia's eyes grew bigger when she remembered that she still had the medallion hidden in her room. "No." She replied with a frantic manner. Jason looked at her like she was about to leap over at him. "I mean, I don't think you should tell anyone." Jason's perplexed look caused Julia having to explain herself. "I mean, you were a boy yesterday, right?" Jason nodded his head in agreement. "And now you have girl parts." Jason again nodded and stopped abruptly knowing where she was going with it. "What do you think the doctors would say?"

"Oh my god." He cried out in fright. "You don't think they will take me away and experiment on me do you?"

Julia, deciding to run with it, agreed with him. "That's what I was thinking." She lied to him. "Let's just keep this between ourselves and see if it clears up."

"Do you think it will?" He again wondered out loud as he looked down at it again and noticed his new, slightly larger nipples were starting to stand at attention, due to the air conditioning starting to circulate.

"Well, it happened over night, right?" She asked as she watched Jason nod his head in agreement. "So maybe it will go away by itself too."

"I guess you're right." Jason agreed. "I will try to hide it and see if it goes away."

"I still think you're trying to pull one over on me." Jason chuckled as he looked back over to the deck of cards, which seemed to call his name. "But I will take it." He quickly handed over the money and clutched his new possession close to his chest as he met his family back at the entrance.
141.title: the playing cards

choices: Flash forward: Uh oh... Peter can't come over.
Flash forward: Peter is allowed to come.
1411.content:
Jason couldn't wait to tell somebody about the cards that he just got at the shop. As he sat in the seat of his family's SUV staring out the window watching the landscape go quickly go by, Jason could only imagine what would happen with the cards. Looking back down at his lap, he read the back of the box to see a small amount of rules written there. He started to read them, well the best he could since the font of the letters kept getting smaller as the words went down the back of the box.

Congratulations to you the owner of this magnificent and life changing deck of cards. To make your games more enjoyable, please follow the rules to help make your transformations a good time.

- The winner of each game will be able to swap anything with one of the losers.
- The winner will have 1 minute to choose before a random swap will take place.


Jason kept on reading and he felt his heartbeat getting faster as he kept reading until he heard somebody breathing behind him. He looked over to see both of his sisters reading the box with him. "What are you guys doing?" He asked quietly to the both of them as he tried to hide the box under his leg.

"Where did you get that?" Julia asked as she tried to reach for the box so that she could read it.

"Who cares where he got it, I doubt it's real." Sarah scoffed as she sat back in her seat and began to look back out the window. "I think it's just a big waste of money."

"What if it was real?" Julia asked quietly to her sister. "I could be taller and the star of the basketball team." She thought to herself out loud.

"It's real." Jason told them, as if he was trying to convince himself to the fact. "At least I hope they are."

"How about we see if they are real tonight." Sarah exclaimed as she leaned closer to them. "Mom and Dad are having a date night tonight and we all can invite a friend over to try it out." Jason thought about it for a moment and nodded. "I will invite Peter over."

"Do you think Mom and Dad will let you have your boyfriend over while they are out of the house?" Jason wondered out loud to his sisters.

"Well, they might if you invite Marie over." Sarah suggested as she brought up Jason's girlfriend.

"And I will invite Nicole over." Julia told the both of them. Nicole was Julia's best friend from a couple door down. While they were good friends, they were also complete opposites. Julia was a tomboy with shoulder length hair, while Nicole was one of the girliest that Jason had ever known.

"Okay." Jason replied as he looked around at his sisters. "Mom and Dad will be leaving around 6 to go to the movies. So if we meet up around 6:30, we should have enough time to play." Both of his sisters nodded their heads in agreement.
1411.title: Jason calls somebody over to help him try out t...

14112.content:
"You can invite him, but I want you guys to stay in the front room." Richard told his daughter, who eagerly nodded her head. "If I hear that you strolled anywhere upstairs with you." Sarah nodded her head again.

"I will make sure he stays down here and we won't do anything." Sarah as she clasped her hands together in appreciation. "And I will make sure Jason does the same thing too."

Richard nodded his head as he looked in the mirror to finish knotting his tie. "Good, because I gave him the same speech too just a few minutes ago." He looked over to the bathroom and found his wife strolling out with her thigh length, light blue dress. "Are you ready to go?"

"Sure am." She eagerly replied back to him. Over the past couple months, there has been a small rift growing between them and their marriage had started to crumble. They both vowed to start having a night to themselves at least twice a month, since their kids were now old enough to stay by themselves without the need of a babysitter.

Several minutes later they left the house and headed for their night on the town. After they left, Sarah phoned Peter and Jason sent a text over to Marie. "Can we start playing now?" Julia asked out loud as she sat on the couch waiting for her friend Nicole to come over.

*** 30 minutes later ***


*Knock knock knock* Sarah eagerly got up and made her way over to the door. As she opened it, she saw her boyfriend Peter there waiting to be invited in. Peter quickly embraced his girlfriend and was invited inside. "About time, let's start this thing." Julia eagerly said a she watched Peter walk into the Dining Room. Sitting next to her was her friend Nicole, then Jason, and Marie.

"So what kind of cards are we playing." Peter wondered as he took a seat next to Julia and had Sarah sitting next to him.

"It says here, that we can play any game of cards and the winner can take something from any of the losers." Jason responded to him. "But for the sake of being easy, I think we should just play Poker. Since almost everyone knows how to play." He looked around and noticed everyone nodding their head. "But before we start we should let everyone know some of the games rules."

"I think we all know the rules for Poker." Peter said as he grabbed the cards out of Jason's hands and started to deal out the cards.

"Wait." Jason called out but it was too late since the game had already started. After several minutes, ________ found that they came out on top and looked around the table.
14112.title: Flash forward: Peter is allowed to come.

choices: Peter is too freaked out and leaves.
141122.content:
"Wait." Jason called out but it was too late since the game had already started. "I was going to tell you some of the rules."

After several minutes, Julia found that she came out on top and looked around the table to see what she would want to take. She finally stopped her gaze on her brother Jason. "I want to swap my height with Jason."

"What do you mean you want to swap..." Peter responded but was cut short by a strange sight. Sarah's brother, Jason was shrinking in height and his sister Julia was gaining. He quickly got up and backed away from the table. "What kind of black magic is this?

Jason looked over to his right and noticed that he only came up to his girlfriend's shoulder. He then looked over to his left and also noticed that he was the same height as Nicole. Both of them seemed shocked at what had just transpired. "What the heck Julia?" Jason yelled over to his sister who seemed happy with her new found height. "Why did you do that? I mean, you could have swapped with Peter." He motioned over to Sarah's boyfriend who was a little too freaked out to realize what was just said.

"I could have, but I didn't want to be a freak." Julia replied back to him as she continued to check out her new perspective. "I will surely be star of the team now." Jason couldn't be too mad at his sister and decided to start the next hand.

"Peter are you going to join us or what?" Jason wondered as he started to deal the cards for the next hand.
141122.title: Julia

1411221.content:
"Peter are you going to join us or what?" Jason wondered as he started to deal the cards for the next hand. He looked over at Peter and noticed that he started to not look too good.

"Umm..." Peter started to stammer as he looked around. "I need to go." He quickly got up and ran out the door with his keys in his hand. Sarah, not really knowing what to do, ran after him trying to get him to come back.

"Well, what do we do?" Marie asked as she looked around the perplexed group. "I mean, do we wait, or do we keep going?"

"I think we can keep going." Julia replied excitedly as she looked down on her brother.

"I say we wait a couple minutes and if they don't come back." Jason said as he shuffled the cards again. They heard a car door slam and they all run to the window to see what was going on. As they looked out the window, they saw Peter's Toyota Tundra pulling out of the driveway with 2 people in the vehicle. Jason sighed as he saw them leave and looked at the rest of the group. "Well, I guess that's our answer."

"Let's go back and play a couple more hands." Marie eagerly said as she quickly made her way back over to the table and sat down with a smile on her face.

"Yeah, come on Jason." Julia exclaimed as she grabbed your hand and dragged you to the table.

"Fine." Jason replied back to them as he sat down between Marie and Nicole. "But I don't want to lose too much."
1411221.title: Peter is too freaked out and leaves.

14112211.content:
Jason dealt out the cards to the 3 other remaining players and looked at his hand to see if he had a better hand than last time. As he looked he felt a surge of happiness well up deep inside him and looked around the table to see if he could see if he actually had a chance. Being over a foot smaller than when he started the beginning of the game, Jason didn't know how to take it. He moved his cards in his hands to get a better look and found 3 Queens smiling at him. "Are you guys ready to show your cards?" Jason wondered as he tried to keep his happiness to himself.

"Yeah." Marie replied to her boyfriend's request and lay down her hand to show the pair of 5's. "I don't think I have anything good."

Both Julia and her friend, Nicole, didn't seem to have anything since they threw down their cards in a matter of disgust. "I didn't get anything good this time." Julia smiled as she still looked around to marvel in her new found height. She was ready to go back to school and play a game or two of Basketball.

"So did I win?" Marie asked as she smiled from ear to ear and started to look around to see what she wanted to get.

"Well..." Jason replied back to her as he lay down his 3 Queens. "Not if my 3 ladies have anything to say about it." He groaned slightly as he looked over at his girlfriend's crestfallen face.

"Do you know what you want to get?" Nicole wondered as she hoped to be included in the game.

"Yeah, I think I do." Jason proudly announced as he looked over at Julia. "I want to swap my height with Julia."

Julia seemed horrified as she looked around and noticed that nothing really changed. "What's going on?" She asked as she seemed relieved that nothing really changed and she still was the tallest person in the room.

"I don't know." Jason answered as he got out the card box out and tried his best to read the smaller rules. With only 20 seconds left, he finally found the rule that he was looking for, but only after having the rules nearly touching his nose. "Well crap."

"What?" The 3 girls asked together as they grew closer to him to see what he was looking at.

"It seems that I can't swap back for another 2 days." Jason sighed after thinking about how he was going to deal with being short for the next couple days, at least. Then, remembering the other rule about the time limit, Jason did a quick look around and quickly stated. "I want to swap umm... Hair with umm... Marie." He felt up on his head to see if the swap took place, but found that his hair was still the same length.

"Is it broken?" Marie asked as she hoped to see her boyfriend with her long dark hair framing his face, but was disappointed to find that it didn't happen.

"No, he didn't make the swap in time." Julia made quick to point out to her. "So according to the rules, he got a random swap." Hearing this, the group looked down at themselves to see if anything changed without them knowing. "I don't feel any different"

"Neither do I." Nicole agreed. "Let's do another hand and we might find out what happened." They all agreed and Jason started to deal another hand for them to play. What they didn't know was that Jason had his gender swapped with Nicole. Everyone would treat him like a girl and Nicole like a boy until they swap back.
14112211.title: Jason wins

141122111.content:
"So you don't know what was swapped?" Marie asked her loving boyfriend of the past 7 months, whom still looking over himself to see what had been swapped out.

"No." Jason replied as he stopped looking and picked up the cards again. "Maybe it wasn't anything at all." He shrugged as he gave the cards a shuffle. Deep down he knew something odd must have been swapped with one of the other players, but he just couldn't see what it was.

"Are you done shuffling them?" Julia asked asked as she watched her brother continue to shuffle them. "I think we're ready to get this game going, shorty." She found it amusing that her older brother was now over a foot smaller than herself.

"Awe, leave him alone." Marie chuckled as she leaned down to give Jason a kiss on his cheek. "I think he looks cute the way he looks right now. Almost like he's funsize." The group, even Jason, couldn't help but laugh at the comment.

"Okay." Jason said with an authoritative tone. "Here we go." He started to hand out the cards to the remaining participants. Making sure to watch their faces as they picked up their cards. Jason was pretty sure that he would be the one to come out on top.

"Meh" Nicole said with disgust as she threw them down in front of her. "I literally didn't have anything." Jason looked around at the others.

"Well, I have a pair of 10s." Julia replied as she lay down her cards to show the group. "I'm sure you all can beat that."

"Well, I have 3 kings." Marie answered as she lay them down in front of her and watched both Jason and Julia's smile fall from their face. "What should I pick?" She asked herself as she looked around the table and stopped on her boyfriend, who shook his head in defiance. "Oh, it's alright. You know how you're always wanting to touch my chest?" Jason blushed as he heard his sister and her friend giggling much like the schoolgirls that they were. "Well, I want to swap chests with Jason." Marie looked down with wonderment as she watched her own chest starting to deflate, much like a balloon losing it's air until it resembled Jason's much more muscular one.

"You look funny." Nicole chuckled as she looked over at Jason, who didn't know what to do with Marie's B-cup breasts now resting on his chest.

"Yeah, yeah." Jason replied as he rubbed his new mammaries and instantly felt turned on. He turned red again as he felt his penis starting to rise up like a soldier standing at attention. Marie, seeing this, leaned over to her boyfried and whispered into his ear.

"I thought you would like them." She whispered seductively. "Maybe I will win again and make you a complete woman."
141122111.title: Marie wins

1411221112.content: What does she swap? And who does she she swap with?
1411221112.title: Nicole finally wins a hand

14112211121.content:
Jason shuffled the cards and certainly felt different doing it with the new additions to his chest. Looking down, he was meant by the globes of flesh that were only a few moments ago on his girlfriend. "Is something wrong?" Julia asked her brother who looked more and more feminine with each hand he lost. Marie's breasts looked absolutely huge on him with his smaller stature and he looked out of place.

Jason shook his head as he looked over and up at his sister, with her height that she got from him. "I was just getting used to having these things." He gestured down to his new expanded chest.

"Oh, I'm sure you'll get used to it." Marie insisted as she motioned down to the cards. "How about you go ahead and deal the cards out and you might get a smaller chest." She then nodded her head over at Nicole's and Julia's smaller chests.

"Yeah, you can have mine, Jason." Nicole eagerly replied as she giggled. "I would love to have a bigger chest."

Jason shook his head as he started to deal out the cards. "We'll see about that." He once again looked around the table as the girls looked at their hands, to mainly see if they had a good hand or not. He noticed Nicole's eyes becoming much bigger as she picked up all the cards.

"What do you all have?" Nicole eagerly asked as she looked down at her hand.

"Your face says it all." Jason replied as he threw down his hand showing that all he really had was a 10 high card, so nothing really good to write home about. "So how about you go ahead and show us."

"Fine." Nicole said grinning from ear to ear. "I had a full house." She showed the group her hand and indeed, just like she told them, she had a full house of 3's over 2's. Marie and Julia sighed as they threw down their hands. She looked over at Jason with a look of predation, much like a snake looking over at a mouse.

Jason gave a gulp of fear as he saw her looking over at him. "Well, what are you waiting for." He replied with his deep baritone voice as he gestured down at his chest. "Take them."

"Oh, all in good time." Nicole giggled as she looked around the group. "I think I will take your puberty."

"My what?" He asked as he gasped in surprise. "Why do you want to take that?"

"Just think back." Nicole instructed him. "Back when it first started, how awkward you must have felt." Jason did as she instructed and certainly did feel awkward, with the growing of hair in strange places, the changing of the voice, and the growing. He certainly didn't want to go through that again, but he was at the mercy this 11 year old girl. "So I want to swap my stage of puberty with Jason."

With this muttered, Jason heard an audible gasp coming from everyone else and felt a wave of change hit him. He looked down at his chest and noticed that they matched his sister's AA cup. "Wow." He froze as he heard his much higher voice.

"You sound funny." Nicole replied with a much more mature voice. She looked over at her and noticed that her AA cup was now a C-cup and she seemed to have grown to meet Marie's height. "You look so skinny." Jason looked down at himself and noticed that his chest was certainly smaller, but so was his arms and legs. All the muscle mass that he got with the puberty was now gone.

"Yeah, Jason, if I didn't know better, I would have thought you were a girl." Marie giggled as she nudged her boyfriend. "I mean with longer hair and clothes, you could certainly pass for one."

"Yeah yeah." Jason said with his much higher voice. "Should we get another hand or two before we quit for the night?"

They all nodded as they waited for Jason to deal them out a couple more hands.
14112211121.title: Swap something mental or physical

141122111212.content:
"I like the way this is going." Nicole replied with a huge grin as she looked down at her much more mature form. Her now C-cup chest looked alien on her body, but she knew that this is what she has to look forward to in the future.

"Yeah, I know what you mean." Julia replied as she stood up and showed the group how much more she towered over the group.

"Yeah, yeah." Jason said with a bit of disdain in his voice. "Let's get this game going so that I can try to look normal." The 3 girls could help but chuckle at the thought.

"I could give you my hair or my clothes." Julia suggested as she did her best to provoke her brother. "You're looking a lot more like a girl than a boy right now." Jason looked down at his form and couldn't help but agree, but fought against it.

"Whatever." He replied as he tried to look serious. "Let's get this had over with." He looked at his cards and knew he couldn't win with the hand and threw it down, effectively folding his hand.

"Don't have anything good?" Marie asked as she looked over at her boyfriend who just shook his head.

"Neither do I." Nicole announced in a pouty manner.

"Well, I have triple 8s." Marie announced as she showed her cards to the rest of the group.

"Oh man." Julia moaned as she showed her hand which only consisted with a pair of jacks.

"What are you going to pick?" Nicole wondered as she looked over at Marie. "Let's change him more in a girl, what do you think?"

Nicole thought about it for a moment. "Even though that sounds like fun, I think I want to try shorter hair." Jason really didn't know what that meant, gulped as he waited for his punishment. "I want to swap my hair with Julia." She watched and marveled as Julia's hair grew darker and slowly made it's way down to her mid back.

"Why did you do that?" Julia groaned as she took a small handful of her new hair a looked at it.

"You have the shortest girl hair here, so I thought I would try it out." Nicole stated as she motioned around at the group.
141122111212.title: Marie wins.

As he sat in the seat of his family's SUV staring out the window watching the landscape go quickly go by, Jason could only imagine what would happen with the cards. Looking back down at his lap, he read the back of the box to see a small amount of rules written there. He started to read them, well the best he could since the font of the letters kept getting smaller as the words went down the back of the box.

Congratulations to you the owner of this magnificent and life changing deck of cards. To make your games more enjoyable, please follow the rules to help make your transformations a good time
.

- The winner of each game will be able to swap anything with one of the losers.
- The winner will have 1 minute to choose before a random swap will take place.



Jason kept on reading and he felt his heartbeat getting faster as he kept reading until he heard somebody breathing behind him. He looked over to see both of his sisters reading the box with him. "Where did you get that?" Julia asked as she tried to reach for the box so that she could read it.

"Who cares where he got it, I doubt it's real." Sarah scoffed as she sat back in her seat and began to look back out the window. "I think it's just a big waste of money."

"What if it was real?" Julia asked quietly to her sister. "I could be taller and the star of the basketball team." She thought to herself out loud.

"It's real." Jason told them, as if he was trying to convince himself to the fact. "At least I hope they are."

"What's that?" Emily asked as she turned around from the passenger seat to see what her kids were talking about.

"Oh, Jason got this deck of cards that can swap stuff around." Julia blabbed, but soon found her brother's hand covering her mouth.

"Let me see them." Emily groaned as she held out her hand for her son to pass up the deck of cards. She always felt protective for her kids and always wanted to make sure that they weren't being made a fool of. Jason sighed as he gave her the deck of cards. She looked them over and handed them back. "I think you were had, honey." She laughed as she turned back to the road.

"No, they're real." Jason protested as he put the cards back into his pocket.

"Fine, when we get back home, we all can spend time together and play a game, hmm?" She put her light purple sunglasses back on her face as she looked out the window.

"I guess." Jason replied.

"Yay." Emily celebrated with a clap of her hands
1413.title: Something else.

14133.content: What about, instead of poker, it's a new version of the "Spoons" card game where you write each player(except the dealer) writes a trait and their name a on piece of paper and grab those when the hand's over, rather than spoons. Then everyone ends up with whatever trait they happened to grab. That way, no one will know what trait they will end up with in the end. Also, even though the dealer doesn't write a trait, they can still end up with someone else's trait by grabbing a piece of paper before someone else does once the hand's over, and if someone happens to grab their own trait, they can take that trait from the loser(the person who didn't grab a paper in time).
14133.title: Something else.

143.content:
Jason highly doubted that these items were magic and his better judgement told him to stay the frick away. However, a part of him was intrigued by the possibilites, especially the stone's.

He sighed and asked, "How much for the stone?"

The girl said, "You know what? You can have it on the house. Your satisfaction is payment enough."

Jason thanked the girl and rejoined the rest of his family, who had found absolutely nothing to buy.
143.title: the odd purple and gray stone

info.brief_description: While visiting a new store, somebody finds a life altering artifact.
info.description:
Jason's family finds a new shop where everything is certainly are not what they seem.

Cast of characters:


Jason Buchanan: (16) 5' 10" in height with brown hair, Jason is always willing to try something new. But between his new girlfriend and the need to get decent grades, he has almost no time for his friends. The stress of trying to be the perfect child is almost too much for him and is looking for an escape.

Sarah Buchanan: (19) 5' 6" in height with a B cup chest and shoulder length dirty blonde hair. Having gotten a full ride scholarship at a local university where she is currently a sophomore and working towards a degree in teaching, Sarah is a little too busy for her family and her parents always try to get her to come over. Currently in a relation with her boy friend of 6 months.

Julia Buchanan: (11) 4' 9" in height with an AA cup chest and light blonde hair flowing past her shoulders. Julia is the baby of the family and always seems to get her way. However her eyes have been opened and is starting to get tired of the treatment. She enjoys playing on her Middle School Basketball team but with her lack of height, which she got from her Mom, she's one of the lesser players that sees alot of time on the bench and is a bit of a tomboy. Goes to an All Girl Catholic School and is wanting to go to regular school.

Emily Buchanan: (39) 5' 2" in height with a D cup chest and shoulder length brown hair, her hair is starting to reflect her aging body, with the grey hair starting to show around her temples. Her job a substitute teacher is what she always wanted and is always willing to spend extra time with her family.

Richard Buchanan: (40) 5' 11" in height with short black hair with some grey hair starting to show. His job as an accountant for a big firm means that he is always away on business and with his late nights at the office, his wife is starting to think that their marriage may be starting to drift apart.

Nicole Stanson: (11) 4' 5" in height with an AA cup chest and brown hair that cascaded down past her shoulders to her mid back. She became friends with Julia since Kindergarten. Living only a couple door down from the Buchanans, she is always a smiling face in the house. She is the exact opposite of her friend, enjoys wearing a dress and playing watching her friends play. Goes to the same school as Julia, but she's starting to look at boys more and more and the All Girl school is starting to drive her mad.

Peter Hilland: (20) 6' 2" in height with closely cropped dark hair. His skin is often tanned due to his love of the outdoors. He attends the same university as Sarah and is majoring in Land Management. He is a devout Christian and thinks magic is a sign of the devil.

Marie Dubois: (15) 5' 5" in height with a small B cup chest and long dark hair that flows down to her middle back. Coming from french heritage, she is fluent in the language. Her brown, doe like eyes was the reason why Jason came to talk to her, but soon found her love of video games and books to be the bridge that brought them together.

Thanks to all the original story ideas:

Medallion of Zulo  

Swap Poker  

Games  

Rings  

Mirror  

Orb  

Urn  

The Old Tome  

Now for some rules...


1. Try to have at least 1,000 characters. The better the chapter, the more points I will award.

2. No killing off any of the main characters. (No unbirthing or anything like that, please.)

3. If some minor characters are added, I have no problem adding them to the list.

4. Please no 'How about' Chapters. This tends to take away from the story.

Now, without further to do, on with the story...
